name: Ansible Playbook Structure Errors
description: Rules for detecting Ansible playbook structure and formatting errors

rules.pattern: Invalid (format|syntax) in (playbook|file)|not a valid (YAML|Ansible) file|parsing error in playbook|malformed playbook|could not parse|YAML syntax error|Ansible syntax error|parsing failed|error parsing|syntax error in playbook|playbook parse error|yaml parse error
rules.description: Invalid YAML syntax in Ansible playbook
rules.suggestion: Fix YAML syntax issues in playbook file
examples: Syntax Error while loading YAML: mapping values are not allowed here
Invalid format in playbook: improper indentation
YAML parsing error in playbook file

rules.pattern: undefined variable|no variable found|variable is not defined|not defined in|unknown variable|undefined var|variable not found|no such variable|variable '.*' is not defined|unknown variable name|could not find variable|undefined name|variable undefined
rules.description: Using undefined variables in Ansible playbook
rules.suggestion: Define variables in vars, vars_files, or use default values with | default
examples: The task includes an option with an undefined variable: {{ undefined_var }}
Error: variable 'app_version' is not defined
No variable found with name 'server_address'

rules.pattern: missing name|no name specified|unnamed task|unnamed play|missing play name|missing task name|task needs a name|play needs a name|missing name attribute|playbook name missing|no name attribute|task should have a name|play should have a name
rules.description: Missing name attribute for plays or tasks
rules.suggestion: Add descriptive name attribute to all plays and tasks
examples: Warning: no name specified for task
Play has no name attribute
All tasks should have a name for better playbook readability

rules.pattern: invalid hosts|no hosts matched|hosts pattern|could not match supplied host pattern|no hosts found|no inventory|missing inventory|empty inventory|all hosts skipped|hosts not found|no matching hosts|hosts list empty|host pattern did not match
rules.description: Invalid or unmatched hosts pattern in playbook
rules.suggestion: Check inventory and hosts patterns in playbook
examples: ERROR! No hosts matched the pattern 'production'
Invalid hosts pattern: could not find group 'webservers'
No inventory was parsed, only implicit localhost

rules.pattern: indentation|wrong indentation|incorrect indentation|bad indentation|inconsistent indentation|improper indentation|invalid indentation|indentation error|not properly indented|must be indented|same indentation|indentation level
rules.suggestion: Fix indentation using consistent spaces (usually 2 spaces)
examples: Error: Indentation is not a multiple of 2
Task options must be indented by 2 spaces
Wrong indentation detected in playbook

rules.pattern: missing module|no module specified|no action specified|unknown module|module not found|no module named|did you mean|could not find|missing required arguments|unable to find module|module .* not found|action plugin not found|action plugin missing
rules.description: Missing or unknown module in task
rules.suggestion: Specify valid module name or install missing collection
examples: No module named 'my_custom_module'
Missing required arguments for module 'copy'
The module 'docker_container' was not found in configured module paths

rules.pattern: deprecated|deprecation warning|deprecated syntax|deprecated feature|no longer supported|use instead|will be removed|has moved|is kept for backwards compatibility|replaced by|is an alias|is deprecated|obsolete syntax|legacy syntax
rules.description: Using deprecated syntax or features in playbook
rules.suggestion: Update to current syntax according to deprecation warnings
examples: DEPRECATION WARNING: include is kept for backwards compatibility
The 'include' module is deprecated, use 'include_tasks' instead
Syntax is deprecated and will be removed in a future version

rules.pattern: recursive loop|maximum recursion depth|too many levels of recursion|include recursion|include nested|include depth exceeded|include cycle|circular dependency|circular include|recursion detected|recursive include|include loop|cycle detected
rules.description: Recursive or circular dependencies in playbook includes
rules.suggestion: Restructure includes to avoid circular references
examples: ERROR! Recursion detected: task includes itself
Maximum recursion depth exceeded in include_tasks
Circular dependency detected: playbook_a.yml -> playbook_b.yml -> playbook_a.yml

rules.pattern: unknown handler|handler not found|no handler named|missing handler|handler .* not found|is not a handler|could not find handler|undefined handler|handler does not exist|no handler called|handler not defined|no handlers matching
rules.suggestion: Define handlers before referencing them in notify
examples: ERROR! handler 'restart apache' not found
Could not find referenced handler 'reload service'
Referenced handler 'reload nginx' does not exist in playbook

rules.pattern: template error|Jinja2 error|jinja2.exceptions|syntax error in template|template syntax|unexpected .* in template|expected .* in template|jinja templating|jinja syntax|template syntax error|undefined jinja variable|unknown tag|undefined jinja|malformed template
rules.description: Invalid Jinja2 template syntax in playbook
rules.suggestion: Fix Jinja2 syntax in templates and variable expressions
examples: template error: unexpected '}' in expression
Jinja2 error: unexpected end of template
Template syntax error: expected name or number
